conclusion: There are four objects labeled A, B, C, and D.
Objects A and B are blocks positioned on a table or surface.
Objects C and D are cloths placed on the table.
Objects E and F are additional blocks placed close to the cloths.
Objects A and B (blocks) are moved through the air towards objects C and D (cloths).
Due to gravity, blocks A and B will make contact with cloths C and D.
When the blocks A and B come into contact with cloths C and D, gravity will cause them to rest on top of the cloths.
The weight of the blocks will create indentations or deformations on the cloths.
After the blocks have settled, observe the deformation in the cloths.
The cloths will show noticeable indentations where the blocks are resting.
The position and effect of the blocks on the cloths will show whether the blocks have settled properly.
The deformation in the cloths around the blocks will confirm the interaction due to gravity.
When objects A and B (blocks) are placed on objects C and D (cloths), the cloths will deform, showing indentations where the blocks rest.
This deformation is a result of gravity causing the blocks to press down on the cloths.
